target_markets.market_description: Holdco entrepreneurs and business buyers looking to acquire or build businesses
pain_points: difficulty finding quality businesses to buy
target_markets.market_size_indicators: Growing number of holdco entrepreneurs, increased competition for business acquisitions

problems_validated.problem: Assets are super expensive and it's very expensive to buy businesses
problems_validated.current_solutions: Traditional M&A through brokers and investment bankers
problems_validated.market_gap: Most buyers competing for same overpriced assets, need alternative approaches

products_tools.name: Duro Software
products_tools.use_case: Software platform for business acquisitions and operations

products_tools.name: Acquisitions Anonymous Podcast
products_tools.use_case: Weekly analysis of businesses for potential acquisition
products_tools.metrics: Only surviving podcast out of 5 started

business_strategies.strategy: Incubate businesses when assets are expensive instead of buying
business_strategies.implementation: Focus on creating new businesses rather than M&A during high asset price periods
business_strategies.case_study: Michael's shift to more incubation over past 4 years due to expensive assets

business_strategies.implementation: Start with own money, do acquisitions, bring equity partners and debt, then professional PE investment
business_strategies.case_study: Duro Software - started self-funded, now 200+ people with 15 acquisitions

problems_solutions.problem: Finding quality businesses to acquire among baby boomer retirements
problems_solutions.solution: Apply systematic filtering to identify truly viable opportunities
steps: Eliminate businesses you don't want to be in
Remove businesses dependent on owner's personal relationships/knowledge/credentials
Focus on businesses not already spoken for

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Following the crowd in business acquisition strategies
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Higher competition, inflated prices, reduced opportunities
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Watch where opportunity is and do something different when everyone says the same thing
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Everyone saying to buy businesses instead of building them

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Overestimating the baby boomer business retirement opportunity
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Wasted time pursuing limited quality opportunities
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Understand it's more like a ripple than a tsunami after filtering out unsuitable businesses
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Many baby boomer businesses are unsuitable or already have succession plans

growth_tactics.tactic: Weekly podcast analyzing potential acquisition targets

metrics_kpis.benchmark: About a dozen businesses for diversified holdco
metrics_kpis.tracking_method: Count of meaningful investments with board involvement
metrics_kpis.optimization_tip: Focus on deep and significant investments rather than just portfolio count

trends_signals.trend: Shift from M&A to business incubation due to high asset prices
trends_signals.opportunity: Create assets when buying assets is expensive

trends_signals.trend: Overvaluation of baby boomer business retirement opportunity
trends_signals.opportunity: Focus on alternative deal sources and business creation

actionable_quotes.quote: When assets are expensive you go create assets
actionable_quotes.context: Discussing strategy for current high-priced M&A market
actionable_quotes.actionability: Shift focus from acquisition to incubation during expensive market cycles

actionable_quotes.quote: If everybody's saying one thing that's usually a sign you should be doing something different
actionable_quotes.actionability: Look for opportunities opposite to popular consensus

actionable_quotes.quote: The Great Deals always seem to have some weird way that they come into your world
actionable_quotes.context: Discussing how best M&A opportunities are found
actionable_quotes.actionability: Focus on network-based deal flow rather than just public listings

key_statistics.context: Growth of Michael's sub-holdco software platform

key_statistics.statistic: 15 companies acquired through Duro Software platform
Portfolio grown from 2-3 businesses to dozen in past 5 years
